intro: Donnellsmithia submontana, commonly known as the Appalachian bellflower, is a rare flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils in shaded forest environments. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected in several states.
